decks.notes: The focus of this combo UB Mill deck is to consistently mill the opponent's library using cards like Ruin Crab, Hedron Crab, and Archive Trap, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Surgical Extraction and Drown in the Loch. By efficiently milling cards from the opponent's deck and depleting their resources, the deck aims to win by forcing them to draw from an empty library or by putting them in a position where they can no longer effectively play their spells.

This deck focuses on using cards like Ardent Plea, Curator of Mysteries, and Shardless Agent to set up for a game-winning combo with Living End. By cycling creatures like Street Wraith and Striped Riverwinder, the player can quickly fill their graveyard and then bring them back with Living End to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes counterspells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation to protect the combo, along with creatures like Endurance and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control and card advantage to help secure the win.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using Goryo's Vengeance while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Leyline Binding and Priest of Fell Rites. It utilizes a variety of lands and spells to facilitate the combo and protect key pieces, ensuring a quick and aggressive game plan. The deck also includes ways to filter through the graveyard and draw additional cards, allowing for consistent and efficient plays. By combining instant reanimation with disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence by playing efficient creatures like Renegade Rallier and Voice of Resurgence. The deck also utilizes powerful spells like Ephemerate to protect its creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while also having some control elements like Anointed Peacekeeper and Endurance to protect its own creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistent plays and the deck aims to finish the game quickly with strong creatures and combat tricks.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures with low mana costs to quickly overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. The deck also includes powerful spells like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Lightning Bolt for removal and reach. Arena of Glory and Static Prison help control the battlefield, while cards like Phlage and Guide of Souls provide additional aggression. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands like Arid Mesa and Windswept Heath, coupled with utility lands like Aether Hub and Sacred Foundry.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through efficient removal and counter spells. It focuses on using cards like Fatal Push, Counterspell, and Force of Negation to control the board, while also utilizing cards such as Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog to provide threats and maintain card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and creating a stable advantage through powerful card advantage engines and disruption.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to generate a large mana advantage by casting spells for reduced cost with Ruby Medallion and other mana-producing cards. The deck aims to quickly amass enough mana to play powerful cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells. Additionally, the deck includes Wish cards to search for specific answers or win conditions, adding an element of flexibility and unpredictability to the combo-focused strategy.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast powerful spells like Flame of Anor, Ral, Monsoon Mage, and Past in Flames. It also utilizes cards like Wish and Valakut Awakening to dig for combo pieces and maintain card advantage. The goal is to create a storm of spells to deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn, while using Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional value. The deck aims to maximize efficiency and explosiveness to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, combined with cards like Ruby Medallion to enable explosive turns. The key strategy is to chain together spells with Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to generate a huge amount of mana and cast powerful spells like Glimpse the Impossible. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and finish them off with a powerful combo finish. The deck also includes cards like Wish for additional versatility and consistency in executing its game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grist, the Hunger Tide to apply early pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements such as Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board and hand. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of aggro threats and disruption. The addition of Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts like Shadowspear or Nihil Spellbomb to further enhance the deck's strategy.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using rituals and mana dorks, then utilize cards like Valakut Awakening and Recross the Paths to find combo pieces while thinning the deck. Once enough mana is generated, the deck can use Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes protection with Pact of Negation and Pact of the Titan. The key strategy is to efficiently generate mana, dig for combo pieces, and win the game with a big Charbelcher activation.
